intro: Andropogon hispidissimus, commonly known as hairy bluestem, is a perennial grass native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, bluish-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers, typical of the grass family Poaceae. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in open woodlands and prairies. Andropogon hispidissimus plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
